greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Index of the least significant digit > 1 in the primorial base expansion of A276086(n), 0 if no such digit exists.
comment: a(n) = index of the least non-unitary prime divisor of A276087(n) or 0 if no such prime-divisor exists.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65537
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
program: A276086(n) = { my(m=1, p=2); while(n, m *= (p^(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m); };
A328828(n) = { my(i=1, p=2); while(n, if((n%p)>1, return(i)); i++; n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (0); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 29 2019
